author: browave.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is no way to recover the lost ETH short of tracking down the scammer and "convincing" them to give it back.

author: Deleted User
content: <@301186049323958275> thank you for your fast response. I did check the Waller on etherscan.io, but since I’m kinda new to all that, I don’t really know what to look for

author: sky.cactus
content: I strongly recommend you just write it off as a loss/learning experience.  The chances of recovering your funds are effectively 0.

author: sky.cactus
content: The scammer very likely lives in a different country than you, and any operation to recover the funds would involve multiple government agencies from multiple countries and the chance that any of the recovered money (in the case of a successful recovery) make it back to the victims is near 0, even if they could track down the scammer and recover the funds.

author: Deleted User
content: Ok, well thank you for your explanations. A hard learning experience (about 1.8 Eth, a lot of money for me), but may it so

author: protolambda
content: Deleted the original message. Please please please never post links to suspected scams. You only confuse people, get accidental clicks, and cause more damage for others.
